title: The Potter’s Daughter and the Div

source_text.text:
A potter’s daughter is carried off by a div to grind his flour. An old woman captive there pities her and gives her a comb, a sack of flour, and a needle for escape.
The daughter slips away at night. The div wakes and charges after her.
She throws the comb— it grows into a thorn forest. She throws the flour— it billows into a blinding fog. She throws the needle— it becomes a wall of brambles. Tangled and lost, the div gives up.
The daughter returns home and is welcomed. She marries a kind neighbor; the old woman is later freed.

source_text_persian.text: دختر کوزه‌گر را دیو می‌برد؛ پیرزن به او شانه، آرد و سوزن می‌دهد. شانه جنگل خار، آرد مه و سوزن بوتهٔ تیغ می‌شود و دیو راه را گم می‌کند. دختر به خانه برمی‌گردد و با همسایه مهربان ازدواج می‌کند.
